sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: 12 more hostages and 30 Palestinian prisoners are exchanged as the temporary truce between Israel and Hamas is extended.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: NATO reiterates its support for Kyiv at the inaugural meeting of the NATO-Ukraine Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The EU's climate commissioner tells Euronews that the global community must be more ambitious at COP28.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Wars, high interest rates and inflation will cause the global economy to slow down next year, according to the OECD.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of Palestinians lined the streets of Ramallah late Tuesday to welcome 30 Palestinian prisoners freed by Israel in the latest swap with hostages in Hamas captivity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This was the fifth day of the temporary truce between Israel and Hamas after a 48-hour extension was agreed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The military wing of Hamas, Al Qassam Brigades, posted a video late on Tuesday, this time showing crowds in Rafah, greeting a convoy of vans arriving at the meeting point where the militants handed 12 hostages to the Red Cross.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There were marked celebrations among Israelis gathered in Sderot, who cheered as the vehicles transporting the released hostages arrived. Hamas and other militants still hold about 160 hostages, out of 240 seized in their October 7th assault on southern Israel that ignited the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A spokesman for the Israeli government has said it would be open to an additional five days of truce under the current hostage-prisoner exchange agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: five days of truce under the current hostage-prisoner exchange agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: During the pause in fighting, the UN World Food Programme is delivering desperately needed food to more than 120,000 people in Gaza, but has reiterated that the supplies it was able to provide were woefully inadequate to address the level of hunger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of thousands that are facing an immediate risk of starvation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: WFP hopes for the extension of this pause, which offered a window of relief that could pave the way for a longer term calm. Safe and impeded humanitarian access cannot stop now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While there does appear to be a willingness to extend the truce, which is due to end after one more captive exchange on Wednesday night, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the fighting will resume with full force.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Scrutiny and increased moderation are essential when it comes to identifying hate speech on the internet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That's according to a new study by the European Union's Agency for Fundamental Rights, FRA.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The report, which focused on more than 1,500 social media posts in Bulgaria, Germany, Italy and Sweden, found that hate speech is on the rise and women are the main target.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Reddit, the social network X, YouTube and Telegram were the four platforms surveyed and almost half of the posts were considered to be direct harassment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It found that people of African descent, Jews and Roma people were also heavily targeted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This follows what researchers have flagged as a huge surge in Islamophobic and anti-Semitic posts since the Israel-Hamas war began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: According to the Jewish advocacy group the Anti-Defamation League, hate speech against Jews has soared more than 919 percent on X for us as independent regulators are imperative to anticipate possible violations of fundamental rights Ukraine's foreign minister greeted by NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This second day of the military alliances gathering in Brussels saw an inaugural meeting of the NATO-Ukraine Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ahead of the talks, Kiev said Ukraine needs more weapons for its fight against Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It will not be an exaggeration to say that defending Europe without Ukraine is a futile task.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: You cannot do it simply for one simple reason, because we currently have the strongest and the most battle-hardened army in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At the gathering, NATO allies vowed to remain steadfast in their commitment to further step up political and practical support to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Welcome to this first meeting of the NATO-Ukraine Council at the level of foreign ministers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We remain unwavering in our commitment to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We are determined that Ukraine will one day sit at this table as a full member of our alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The meeting also saw the return of former British Prime Minister David Cameron, this time as Foreign Secretary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On the ongoing war, Stoltenberg said Ukraine has inflicted heavy losses on Russia Brussels is accusing Poland of not doing

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: enough to put an end to around-the-clock blockade by truckers and farmers on the border with Ukraine for days thousands of lorries have been stranded in queues as truckers claim they are losing out to Ukrainian companies transporting goods inside the European Union. There is not good faith in finding a solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This is my evaluation today and it's a nearly complete lack of involvement of Polish authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And I'm saying that because the Polish authorities are the ones who are supposed to enforce the law at that border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And while I support the right of people to protest, the entire EU, not to mention Ukraine, a country currently at war, cannot be taken hostage by blocking our external borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's as simple as that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Polish truckers started the protest earlier this month to call on Brussels to force Ukrainian counterparts to obtain a permit to enter the bloc, except for those carrying humanitarian aid or military supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: This would be a return to a previous system that was paused after Russia launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: They argue that they are losing out to Ukrainian companies that are offering cheaper out to Ukrainian companies that are offering cheaper rates to transport goods. Meanwhile, Ukrainian drivers have been waiting in their trucks to cross the border as temperatures are now freezing and many are worried about the situation back home. The European Commission says it is talking to all parties involved to find a solution, but also stressed that it could intervene to ensure rules are respected and laws are followed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: and laws are followed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The international community meets Thursday in Dubai for the UN climate conference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The European Union intends to make its voice heard with a simple message to its partners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: We must be more ambitious.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The bar is simply very high, not because we want to, but because scientists tell us so.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So we do need to deliver as a global community on mitigation, driving down emissions, making sure we have emissions peak in 2025.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It is coming up with a credible tripling targets of renewables.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It is energy efficiency and it is driving out methane.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: For the EU, the establishment of the first global stock take at COP28 will be an important step in assessing the efforts made since the 2015 Paris Agreement and what still needs to be done to limit the rise in temperatures to 1.5 degrees Celsius.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Global stock take is what the world really says. It is taking stock, seeing where we stand. But more importantly is then how to move forward. And the reality is that we have the direction correct, but we simply need to run faster. We need to do more going forward. So stocktaking is here also equivalent with higher ambitions and countries pledging to doing more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The EU and developed countries will be eagerly awaited by their partners on the issue of financing climate action and the loss and damage fund set up at the previous COP.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: This tool is intended to respond to the damage caused by the adverse effects of climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But questions remain about who will contribute to the fund.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The solidarity expected by developing countries requires funding.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We have been working tirelessly, also here from within the European Union, to see how we can deliver on more funding and on loss and damage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And I am more optimistic than a couple of weeks ago that we can deliver on this critical element.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And making sure we get the financing right is a very important part also in building trust.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The EU's climate commissioner says it's difficult to pinpoint the indicators that will make it possible to determine whether COP28 can be called a success or failure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: For observers, it'll be necessary to look at the ambition of the commitments announced in order to assess whether or not the international community is making progress on climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Intense snowfall in the north of the United States, the first of the season, creating

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: dangerous conditions on the roads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ohio is the worst hit state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The whiteout around the Great Lakes region along the Canadian border is due to a weather phenomenon called lake effect snow, caused by a collision between cold air from the north and the warmer water of the lakes. The subsequent convection leads to heavy snowfall. Winter weather warnings are in effect in several areas across the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: An island around 600 miles south of Tokyo has grown by 50 meters since the start of November after volcanic activity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to the Japanese Coast Guard, its eruption reached a height of 200 meters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Footage of Nijima Island in Japan's Ogasawar archipelago was captured by drones. The Coast Guard said it's monitoring the volcano and will issue navigational warnings and other advisories regarding the eruption. For now, it's urging caution for vessels navigating close by.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The strain of wars, inflation and high interest rates will cause the global economy to falter

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: next year, despite better than expected GDP growth in 2023. That's according to the OECD, which predicted that economic growth would slow to 2.7% next year, down slightly from the expected figure of 2.9% this year, marking the slowest calendar year growth since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We remain worried about inflation. If inflation were to prove more persistent, further tightening would be necessary, pushing growth down further.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The economies of the 20 countries that use the euro were hit by high interest rates and energy prices after Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Growth in the eurozone is predicted to hit 0.9% next year, weak compared to China and the United States, but still an improvement from a predicted 0.6% growth this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But the OECD warned that the full impact of interest rates in the eurozone is still uncertain, due in part to the region's high level of bank financing.
